i use mac os and i wasn't thinking about how this os opens files in windows. when i clicked on the link using firefox.... all went well.
(i promise i am not chromosomally-challenged :D)

to answer your question: first you need to place the .srt files in their corresponding video folders. then you only need a video player that recognizes .srt files. 
my personal preference is vlc. unfortunately, my first prob with vlc arose when trying to watch this very film, as it seems there is a bug related to autodetection of subtitles in the current version.
luckily, they have an unofficial version available that fixes this prob. i downloaded it, and the subtitles are working perfectly now. 

you can dowload it here: 
http://nightlies.videolan.org/
i hope this helps.
here are the subtitles again: http://www.yousendit.com/transfer.php?action=download&ufid=FDC50DF37DC352DC
